meanings.definition: To exert force on (someone or something) so as to cause movement towards oneself.
meanings.sent1: She pulled the heavy box towards her with all her strength.
meanings.sent2: He pulled the door open to enter the room.
meanings.sent3: The little girl pulled her puppy closer for a hug.
meanings.sent4: The magnet pulled the metal objects towards it like magic.
meanings.sent5: The tractor pulled the plow through the field effortlessly.

meanings.definition: To extract or remove (something) by force.
meanings.sent1: He pulled out a coin from his pocket to show his friends.
meanings.sent2: She pulled the weeds out of the garden to make it neat.
meanings.sent3: The magician pulled a rabbit out of his hat to everyone's surprise.
meanings.sent4: The dentist pulled the tooth out quickly to relieve the pain.
meanings.sent5: The chef pulled the cake out of the oven when it was perfectly baked.

meanings.definition: To draw or haul towards oneself or itself, in a particular direction or into a particular position.
meanings.sent1: The tugboat pulled the ship towards the harbor.
meanings.sent2: She pulled the curtains closed to block out the sunlight.
meanings.sent3: The child pulled the blanket over his head to hide from monsters.
meanings.sent4: The strong wind pulled the kite high up into the sky.
meanings.sent5: The gardener pulled the weeds out of the flowerbed to make it look tidy.
